gov.nih.nlm.ling.graph

Class SemanticGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractGraph<V,E>
      • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractBaseGraph<V,E>
        • org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleDirectedGraph<V,E>
          • org.jgrapht.experimental.dag.DirectedAcyclicGraph<SemanticItem,java.lang.String>
            • gov.nih.nlm.ling.graph.SemanticGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, org.jgrapht.DirectedGraph<SemanticItem,java.lang.String>, org.jgrapht.Graph<SemanticItem,java.lang.String>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoreferenceSemanticGraph

    public class SemanticGraph
extends org.jgrapht.experimental.dag.DirectedAcyclicGraph<SemanticItem,java.lang.String>
    Represents the semantic content of a Document as a directed graph where the nodes are Term objects and the edges between the nodes represent roles.

    A SemanticGraph is constructed as a result of bottom-up semantic composition. However, a cleanup, constraint-checking is still probably necessary after it's built up.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getDocument

      • addSemanticNode

        public void addSemanticNode(SemanticItem parent,
                            SemanticItem sem,
                            java.lang.String role)
        Adds the semantic item sem to the graph. If the parent is null, sem is only added to the graph, without linking it to any other semantic item. Otherwise, an edge is created between the parent and the sem. The id of the edge has the form role:pId:sId, where pId is the id of the parent and sId is the id of the sem.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent of the semantic object, can be null
        sem - the semantic object to add
        role - the relation type between the parent and the object, can be an empty string
